meanings.definition: The process of making someone less sensitive to allergens through gradual exposure.
meanings.sent1: Hyposensitization can help reduce allergic reactions over time.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often recommend hyposensitization for patients with severe allergies.
meanings.sent3: The hyposensitization process is like training your body to be less bothered by allergens.
meanings.sent4: Hyposensitization is like building a shield against allergens in your system.
meanings.sent5: Through hyposensitization, one can develop a tolerance to allergens.

meanings.definition: The treatment of allergies by administering gradually increasing doses of the allergen.
meanings.sent1: Hyposensitization involves giving small amounts of allergen to build immunity.
meanings.sent2: Some people undergo hyposensitization to lessen their allergic reactions.
meanings.sent3: Imagine tricking your body with tiny bits of allergen in hyposensitization treatment.
meanings.sent4: Hyposensitization is like teaching your body to fight off allergens better.
meanings.sent5: With hyposensitization, the body learns to handle allergens more effectively.
